description: From Ancient Greek εἰρηνικός (eirēnikós, “characterized by peace, peaceful”) + English -ic (suffix forming adjectives with the sense ‘of or pertaining to’). Εἰρηνικός (Eirēnikós) is derived from εἰρήνη (eirḗnē, “peace”) (possibly from εἴρω (eírō, “to fasten together”) (ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *ser- (“(verb) to bind, tie together; (noun) thread”)), or εἴρω (eírō, “to say, speak”) (ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *werh₁- (“to say, speak”))) + -ῐκός (-ikós, suffix forming adjectives with the sense ‘of or pertaining to’).

adjectives.description: irenic (comparative more irenic, superlative most irenic)

entries.meaning: (chiefly theology) Promoting or fitted to promote peace, especially over disputes; conciliatory, non-confrontational, peaceful.
examples: Antonyms: contentious, disputatious, polemic, polemical, unirenic; see also Thesaurus:quarrelsome
